newsitem.title: FRANCE: ONIC sees rise in 96/97 French wheat exports - trade.
newsitem.headline: ONIC sees rise in 96/97 French wheat exports - trade.

text.p: France's grain office ONIC forecast soft wheat exports to non-EU destinations in the new 1996/97 season may rise to 6.7 million tonnes from a provisional 3.75 million tonnes in 1995/96, trade sources said on Wednesday.
The figures prepared ahead of the September 12 release of ONIC's first supply/demand report for the new season are subject to confirmation and may be altered before publication.
Onic's draft also suggests France would end the 1996/97 campaign with a soft wheat stock of 2.193 million tonnes against 2.230 million in 1995/96.
French soft wheat exports to the rest of the European Union were put at 8.0 million tonnes against 8.613 million in 1995/96.

Barley exports to non-EU countries were forecast at 1.8 million tonnes against 221,000 last year. Barley exports to the rest of the EU were seen declining to 1.93 million tonnes from 2.244 million tonnes in the past season.
France should end the 1996/97 season with a barley carryover of 726,000 tonnes against 629,000 tonnes in 1995/96.
Maize exports to non-EU destinations were put at between 400,000 tonnes and 1.4 million tonnes against 164,000 tonnes in 1995/96.
Maize exports to the rest of the European Union were expected to reach 5.57 million tonnes against 6.087 million.
Exports of soft wheat flour to non-EU destinations were forecast at 1.98 million tonnes against 1.81 million in 1995/96
The draft also suggested that some 5.7 million tonnes of French soft wheat may be used for animal feed in 1996/97 against 5.6 milllion in 1995/96.
ONIC put the use of maize and barley in feed at 2.05 million and 950,000 tonnes, respectively.
This would compare with 1.91 million tonnes of maize and 862,000 tonnes of barley used in feed in 1995/96.
